title: Workflow
code: # Enable the KWB-R universe repository options(repos = c(   kwbr = "https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev",   CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org")) # Install R package install.packages("geosalz.phreeqc")

title: Workflow
code: library(geosalz.phreeqc)  file_samples <- system.file("extdata/phreeqc-input.csv",                             package = "geosalz.phreeqc")  samples <- read.csv2(file_samples)  knitr::kable(samples) samples_tidy <- geosalz.phreeqc::tidy_samples(samples) %>%   geosalz.phreeqc::convert_to_numeric_lab_values()  samples_tidy #> # A tibble: 117 × 7 #>    solution_id solution units parameter value  outOfLimit numericValue #>          <int> <chr>    <chr> <chr>     <chr>  <chr>             <dbl> #>  1           1 dc174fda ppm   temp      12.5   ""                12.5  #>  2           1 dc174fda ppm   pH        7.79   ""                 7.79 #>  3           1 dc174fda ppm   Fe.2      0.98   ""                 0.98 #>  4           1 dc174fda ppm   Mn        0.37   ""                 0.37 #>  5           1 dc174fda ppm   C.4.      177.00 ""               177    #>  6           1 dc174fda ppm   Ca        101.00 ""               101    #>  7           1 dc174fda ppm   Mg        7.26   ""                 7.26 #>  8           1 dc174fda ppm   Na        16.30  ""                16.3  #>  9           1 dc174fda ppm   K         1.32   ""                 1.32 #> 10           1 dc174fda ppm   N..3.     0.10   ""                 0.1  #> # … with 107 more rows
